intro: Globba fasciata, commonly known as the zebra plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Zingiberaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its striking, zebra-like patterns on its leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil. Globba fasciata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ease of care.
